author: Special Correspondent
text:
Political parties, including CPI (M), CPI, Viduthalai Chiruthai Katchi and Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam, have demanded that the Higher Education Department should not appoint Vice-Chancellors in existing vacancies until the Madras High Court’s verdict on a case regarding appointment of Vice-Chancellors to State-run universities.

In a joint release, the parties have said that the speed with which the government has decided to fill up the vacancies in the three universities, namely the Manonmaniam Sundaranar University, Tiruvalluvar University and the Tamil Nadu Teacher Education University only led them to believe that there was corruption in the appointments.

UGC norms violation

The release has said that both the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam and the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam-led governments had violated the University Grants Commission norms regularly. This had led to academician M. Anandakrishnan filing a petition in the High Court seeking transparency in appointment of Vice- Chancellors. Since the decision of the court was expected on February 8 the government should withhold any announcement on appointments, the political leaders have said.

A similar appeal has also been made by A. Narayanan, director of Change India, who has also filed a petition in this regard along with Prof. Anandakrishnan. Mr. Narayanan has written to the Governor stating that announcing the selection would be sub judice .
title: ‘Don’t appoint VCs till HC verdict’
